stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email Containing a Malicious PowerPoint Attachment
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 12 November 2014, a government department was targeted with a phishing email that contained a malicious PowerPoint document. If executed, the malicious PowerPoint document attempts to install the Poison Ivy implant and two files. The implant attempts to communicate with ww1.molnews.net over port 80.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:

boundary="537826103-490356718-1415606475=:57656" X-Barracuda-Connect: nm4.bullet.mail.bf1.yahoo.com[98.139.212.163] X-Barracuda-Start-Time: 1415606478 X-Barracuda-URL: http://10.1.1.140:8000/cgi-mod/mark.cgi X-Virus-Scanned: by bsmtpd at barracudanetworks.com X-Barracuda-BRTS-Status: 1 X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: -1001.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=-1001.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=3.5 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=6.0 X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - [REDACTED] X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - [REDACTED] X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [47 12] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - yahoo.com X-Get-Message-Sender-Via: [REDACTED]: redirect/forwarder owner [REDACTED] -> [REDACTED] ----- END EMAIL HEADER ----- ----- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ----- Amryg ereye
Hundetgesen. -- [REDACTED NAME] Counselor, military adviser Permanent Mission of Mongolia to the UN [REDACTED CONTACT INFORMATION] ----- END EMAIL BODY -----

This file is a malicious PowerPoint document that contains the Poison Ivy implant.
The following files are embedded in the PowerPoint file: Slides.inf (MD5: 370A6584927C7FCBE23B2BAC67E4F2CA) Slide1.gif (MD5: 2D6BA3C3D6BEC80D8D935D312315FA72)

The file nomiin ug.pps is a legitimate PowerPoint document that contains the Poison Ivy implant attempting to install this file.
According to the data source report, this file only performs malicious behavior if opened on Windows 7; it will not open on Windows XP machines.
This file renames "slide1.gif" to "slide1.gif.exe" and places the file in the %temp% directory. It then adds itself to the registry using the command "HKLM,Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce,Install,,cmd /c start %1%\slide1.gif.exe"

This file renames "slide1.gif" to "slide1.gif.exe" and places the file in the %temp% directory. It then adds itself to the registry using the command: "HKLM,Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce,Install,,cmd /c start %1%\slide1.gif.exe"
This enables "slide1.gif.exe" to be installed, placed in the RunOnce registry key, and executed.

This is a Poison Ivy remote administration tool (RAT) that performs a DNS query for the domain "www1.molnews.net". It then attempts to connect to port 80. If successful, data is sent out.
Additional behavioral activity information can be found here: https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/8897c503aa592afb218b4779942e9e769569cf732307a006e7be59ddb29f6836/analysis/
